intro: Oenothera guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and branching. Oenothera guadalupensis is also known for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its reproductive success in its native habitat.
